website_summaries.verdict: The Reebok All Terrain Super 3.0 has captured the attention of many running-enthusiasts in the community owing to its great all-around The shoe offers good traction on tricky surfaces; also, is comfortably light in weight with an efficient drainage system and has a great look. It is a fair investment for neutral runners looking for a comfortable yet sturdily built shoe to run on trails.
pros: Most of the users called the Reebok All Terrain Super 3.0 a highly comfortable shoe
Several runners were happy with the lightweight nature of the shoe
A wearer lauded the excellent grip of the outsole, especially on the unpredictable terrains
A trail racing enthusiast mentioned that the drainage system of the Reebok All Terrain Super 3.0 was very effective
his feet remained comfortably cool and free of retained water
Some of the customers appreciated the snug fit of the shoe
An individual liked how the footwear looked good
cons: A few users had durability issues with the shoe
A purchaser thought that the Reebok All Terrain Super 3.0 was a bit expensive
Some runners mentioned that the traction was not so good on slippery surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Fitting this shoe is as unique as the events for which they are made
customer_reviews.text: Very event specific shoe. These are made for Obstacle Course Racing, specifically Spartan or tough mudder type events, where you will be battle both knee deep mud, and then trying to climb a hill or a wall and need traction. I have not raced in them yet, but they are definitely sized to be worn differently. It’s more like a glove than a shoe or boot. I ended up ordering 3 pairs to determine the one that fit me appropriately. I ended up 1.5 sizes down from my normal running/training shoe. I’m optimistic it will perform well. I’m super glad I’m a prime member, which allowed me to obtain the correct shoe without spending a fortune in shipping/return.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, lightweight. Runs big, I usually wear 12, had to go down to 11. Little on the expensive side. A must have for OCR. Ran a Spartan beast yesterday in these and they were amazing. Grip for days and the drains water extremely well. Would been five stars if there were cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I had run with the old all terrain last season ...
customer_reviews.text: I had run with the old all terrain last season and then they came out with these and I was hoping they would last longer then the 2.5 did. (pinkie toe hole) So far I have only worn for some training runs and Tuxedo sprint. Palmerton next weekend will be my 2nd with these shoes. I prefer these over my inov-8s for spartan because of the rope climbs. I wear a 10 1/2 in womens and got these in a 9 mens. I had no issues with the wet grass and such at tuxedo.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Toe box is oversized
customer_reviews.text: The toe box in these are HUGE for their size. Like clown shoe huge. I have some of the original Reebok All-Terrain Super OCR shoes. Love them. I got these for my son for XC season. He thought they felt great when he tried them on. wore but then he them to one practice and the toe box is so huge that he ended up with multiple blisters on each foot. Be sure to really put these through the paces when you try them on.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, grippy, and very light.
customer_reviews.text: There’s a lot of detail in the shoe that isn’t fully appreciated until you hold it in your hands. I actually felt anxious as I was about to put them on, thinking that maybe their style outmatched their substance. A pang of relief shot through me as one foot slid perfectly into place, then the other. Everybody’s feet are different, but these are awesome for me. It feels good knowing I have the perfect shoe for my next Spartan Race. Now to find the right socks...
customer_reviews.author: dnL

customer_reviews.title: and is wide open for foreign material entry - not good in the mud
customer_reviews.text: They fit a bit large, and the ankle area is sort of floppy? What I mean is, even when fully fastened, the ankle opening is too large, and is wide open for foreign material entry - not good in the mud.
customer_reviews.author: josh hockman

customer_reviews.title: Light, flexible and great grip
customer_reviews.text: Light, flexible and great grip. I absolutely love these. I have two pairs now and using them for hiking. The sole is spot on as far as flex and stability I'm 220lbs.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and sturdy too
customer_reviews.text: My husband got these for when he ran his first Spartan Race and they performed perfectly. They were lightweight but sturdy, and he was able to hose all of the mud off pretty easily. The serious traction helped him going through all of the obstacles as well. So glad we found such a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Christensen

customer_reviews.title: 10 Mile Shoes.... =(
customer_reviews.text: I received these on Wednesday and the heels are coming off!!! It looks like both of them and they were only used for a few miles. This, I hope is just a defective pair, because these would be $10 per mile shoes at this point. I cant imagine them actually being "all terrain". Sad.
customer_reviews.author: D Ramos

customer_reviews.title: TOUGH MUDDERS
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair for me and my husband! we have done 10+ Tough Mudders and Spartans each and these shoes are great!
customer_reviews.author: Joleana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best shoes I’ve had. Survived deployment, lots of miles, lots of different weather and terrain. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Fox #237

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight OCR shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe almost held up through the beating I gave them this year. Too many rope climbs and wet crossings led to them peeling apart toward the end of the season.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes for trail running
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes for trail running. Very different feel than my Solomon Fellraisers. These feel lighter and more flexible. I can feel the ground more with these as well, but I don't mind it at all. Given the choice between the two, I'd probably go with these Reebok's again next time.
customer_reviews.author: JEL

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect and very comfortable while running over various terrain. Like the no tongue and the way the laces pulls the shoe tight around the foot.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Martz

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Fit great. While waiting for start of first race, I tightened the laces and the first two eyes ripped right out. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L. Reindl

customer_reviews.title: They gripped very well and I didn't slip while others around me couldn't get a good grip in the mud
customer_reviews.text: They are slightly larger than my other Reebok trail running shoes but I didn't have any issues with them on the trail. They gripped very well and I didn't slip while others around me couldn't get a good grip in the mud. They didn't hold any water and the mud came off pretty easily after I was out of the mud obstacles. I wore them for the Spartan Sprint in Houston. If you tighten the laces too tight the metal ring around the last lace hole will hurt.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Very light and perfect for obstacle course race
customer_reviews.text: Very light and perfect for obstacle course race. Water flushes out the shoe easily, making it easy to run after it gets wet.
customer_reviews.author: PNOLA

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made shoes, don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Shoe ripped after one Spartan race. Absolute garbage, do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: cg

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great trail shoe! Looking forward to racing in Spartan races with these. The grip is great and are super comfy despite being a pretty minimal shoe. I don't recommend running on wet pavement as they are really slippery but when they hit the trail they are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Graff

customer_reviews.title: Fat feet
customer_reviews.text: I have wide get and Reebok doesn't make these kind of shoes in a wide so they are a little snug.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: A little on the snug side but once they're on ...
customer_reviews.text: A little on the snug side but once they're on you forget they are even there. Started using them for OCR training and hiking and haven't had a problem with them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoes for running on the trails
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoes for running on the trails. And for any spartan races, but not in the stadiums.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THEM!!! WISH ME LUCK AT MY FIRST SPARTAN RACE!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Guzman

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I even posted to my insta how much I love these shoes. They hug my feet and the road. They are light weight but the exterior feels like it can take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Nice construction and high durability
customer_reviews.text: Ran a Spartan with these and they performed very well. Nice construction and high durability.
customer_reviews.author: Obi

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are perfect for running an OCR
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are perfect for running an OCR. They were bigger than expected so I returned them for half size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great OCR shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I bought them for the Spartan runs and have done 2 Sprints so far. Both Sprints were very muddy, but my shoes never felt like they would come off and they gave me great traction.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley S Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Felt good just too large
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10.5 in Nike and practically everything else and a 10.5 in these Reebok were .5 too large. Felt good just too large. Returned for the 10.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy with the description of these shoes, they looked alot better in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Tough and good in races....
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes - hard to find - hopefully more available in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Capron

customer_reviews.title: The shoe looks great. It feels light and feels good while running
customer_reviews.text: The shoe looks great. It feels light and feels good while running, it is a quality product. It does run a little small though, especially in the arch of the foot. This also results in not the greatest arch support so I would suggest not using it too much on concrete. The real issue is the shipping. After ordering I was told that the product was on back order even though it never said they were out on the website. Amazon was super helpful and really did try their best to correct the issue though so hats off to them. Just if you order be ready to wait quite a while for the product to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what you get.
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would try a pair. Expensive pair of trail runner shoes but I do not believe after getting them that they will hold up to much "trail" abuse. I have owned quite a few pair of Solomon shoes and like the quality of them much better for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bates

customer_reviews.title: i want to get a new good pair please
customer_reviews.text: When i opend the package and i took a look on the shoes then i found in the right foot pair that the sewing from inside is destroyed, i want to get a new good pair please.
customer_reviews.author: Fawaz

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe I sent them back for a smaller size
customer_reviews.author: George s cochran

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and they drain really well.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Just ran my first Spartan race in them. I got real muddy and wet, and they drained really well to help me keep going. I hosed them down at the end and now they look good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

product_meta.title: Reebok Men's All All Terrain Super 3.0 Trail Runner
product_meta.description: Tackle the trail in the Reebok All Terrain Super 3.0. H2O Drain technology effectively drains water from the shoe, and obstacle grip with 360-degree tread deliver responsive traction. Ripstop materials and a toe bumper maximize durability.
feature_bullets: Obstacle grip with 360-degree traction and underfoot rock guard
